name: Parkhotel Sonnenhof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on our way from Switzerland to Austria. All our travel was by train and the hotel arranged a taxi from nearby Buchs station. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would have liked to have stayed at least another day although the cost is very expensive, especially if you eat in the hotel. Having said that, the hotel has a Michelin star and the food and dining surroundings were both exceptional. We would definitely recommend this hotel for a spot of luxury with a personal touch. We loved it and our room was superb..
reviews.title: A touch of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: A lovely place, lovely experience, in a wonderful setting. The terrace ( which is architecturally interesting on its own) has the best view of the castle in the near distance in one direction, and snow capped peaks beyond a green valley in the other direction. Dining room has glorious food and a gorgeous view through big wide, clear and clean windows. Breakfast includes anything you could want. Dinner, while expensive, is worth it. Beautifully presented and full of tiny surprises of taste. Front desk staff very helpful and kind. Good, unobtrusive service. Our room, while not huge, was luxurious and tasteful, and all-in-white, very peaceful. Pathways that start very near the hotel lead off into beautiful woods -- I only wish I had had more time there to explore.
reviews.title: luxurious but not pretentious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, a firm 4 star +. The food was nice, the rooms are well designed and quite large, the bed was a dream - very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was delicious, not bad room-service. Nice location, a small walk to the city center. A nice touch was that you can meet the owners in the restaurant in the evening and that they ask you how you find your stay.
reviews.title: A nice family owned hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The pool area could use a few signs pointing to different facilities - a bit confusing for the first time.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I've stayed on business a few times already at this lovely hotel and it was always great. Outside of the quality of the hotel overall (food is great, rooms and location as well), I especially appreciate the personal attention and the friendliness of all staff. If you are going to Liechtenstein, this is a must.
reviews.title: Grand old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel during second part of August '11. This is the best hotel we've ever seen. We visited a lot of 5 star hotels all around the world (Europe, Scandinavia, French Polynesia, Maldives, Russia, Japan, etc.) and we consider Sonnenhof to be the best one among all! We suggest to choose rooms on the ground floor because they have access to the grass plot (junior suite). The staff and service are excellent. When we spontaneously decided to rent a car and go to Firenze, they have called us to know whether is everything OK with us or we need any support. They are really great. We highly recommend this hotel! It is not a bargain, but it really cost its money! The only word we have is: "WOW!"
reviews.title: It should be 6 stars at least

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this hotel for a special weekend treat. Not disappointed at all! All my expectations were surpassed. Fabulous food served by Hubert's knowledgeable and wonderfully helpful staff! It is an extremely comfortable, tranquil hotel about half mile from train station. The 'well-ness centre' has an indoor heated pool, sauna and an infrared room. There is also yoga and massage available plus lots of other papering options. The best bit is all these facilities are a two minute walk from your room - in many similarly equipped hotels you have a longish trek and then a changing room before you arrive at the pool - not here - just slip on a comfy bath-robe and two minutes later you're in the 'well-ness centre'. So easy to have a quick swim before breakfast or a sauna before dinner. On the first night, we were welcomed at dinner by the owner. Without exception everyone went out of their way to provide the thoughtfulness that makes for a memorable holiday. 'Luxury hotels' need to work hard to justify their premium - the Park Hotel Sonnenhof has all the usual ingredients - amazing peaceful location, fantastic talent in the kitchen overseen by an amazing chef (the tasting menu is quite sublime) and great facilities - but what made it special for me was the genuine warmth and interest of every single member of staff that I met in making my stay special. The hotel website talks a lot about it being a family affair - and it is absolutely true. I would also venture that despite the price it offers very good value for money because of the supremely high standard of what you get. I look forward to returning for a longer stay. Mustn't forget the free wi-fi which works automatically - not logging in nonsense and the combination iPad / iPhone and mobile phone charger on your beside table - how cool is that!
reviews.title: A relaxing luxurious hotel, in beautiful Liechtenstein - amazing staff too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was not very easy fo find the hotel. I confess I would not without a GPS, the hotel is very nicely set at the top of the moutains in Lichenstein with a great view of the valley below it and also the the mountains on the other side. We were give a great room with a big terrace and althoug it was winter the room was bright, all decorated in yellow.
reviews.title: Excellent and Cozy Relais e Chateaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire hotel is very cozy and has an eye for detail. From the furniture to the Fruits available for the guests with dishes, silveware and very white napkins to be taken to the room. The only downside was the Breakfast Buffet that was not that great. One of the three nights we stayed we were told since there were only 5 guests staying at the hotel, they would not have any Buffet at all. It was deceiving for this kind of a Hotel.
reviews.title: Warm and gracious with an incredible restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was a perfect stop after landing in Zurich from a transatlantic flight before proceeding to a week of skiing. From parking lot entry to our exit, we could not have felt more welcome by the Real family and the hotel staff. I do believe these folks were really glad to see us without being excessive, mechanical or over the top. These folks meant it.
reviews.title: Prestigious, "old style" establishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Awesome location, terrific view, friendly staff (special mention to Helmut), delicious food. But the shower space...I am only 1.71cm tall and can't barely move without hitting my elbow. Even Ibis properties bathroom are not that small. But this is a minor detail, as I had a great time. Free wifi and parking.
reviews.title: A great hotel with a tiny bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: I have stayed here many times. Be it over night or only for lunch on a summer day in the rhine valley. With my wife, alone or with associates or clients.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Never disappointed. A bit pricey, but worth every penny!
reviews.title: A night at!
Beutiful scenery and setting
reviews.text: If you stay, eat there. If for several days, eat "yourself" through the whole menu! It's worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister and i spent sadly just one night at the Sonnenhof! The hotel had a great feel as we entered, very friendly Staff, beautiful room! Absolutely amazing food! A must to try!
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very peaceful, charming hotel in Vaduz at a surprisingly good value. I had a small, but very well appointed and comfortable room with a great view of the nearby castle from the window.
reviews.title: Castle views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner at the hotel is pricey, but quite good and definitely worth checking out. There is a swimming pool, but not a full gym - however the local roads are great for running.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Vaduz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay again in a heartbeat on my next visit to Vaduz
reviews.title: Very nice, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drove to Vaduz while on a trip through Germany and Switzerland and stopped here on a whim. No problem finding an available room on a Monday. Staff at reception was wonderful. Grounds are beautiful, only a short walk away from the castle. Room was immaculate and large. Bed was nice but had typical european hardness.
reviews.title: I loved the view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After taking a long hike, we elected to have dinner at their restaurant. Lovely setting and uncrowded. Had the tasting menu and every item was delicious.
reviews.title: In most respects excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visiting Oberammergau with a group for the Passion Play last weekend 22 - 24 May; this hotel was super. Beautiful location on the river, clean, wonderful balcony view of the town and within easy walking distance of the theatre. Staff were friendly and super efficient, getting us through dinner in plenty of time for the performance in the evening. Breakfast on the sun terrace was an added pleasure. They even served Dinner for 43 at 11 p.m. when we arrived late courtesy of BA. Wished we could have stayed longer and explore this beautiful area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Bavarian Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: Oberammergau is a small town high up in the mountains of Bavaria. Named after the Ammer river, which flows through the village, Oberammergau has a storybook quality to it with its half-timbered medieval dwellings and frescoed exteriors. The Parkhotel Sonnenhof is a chalet style hotel on the opposite side of the river with a magnificent view of the town and church. It's a short walk to the shops and restaurants, maybe five to ten minutes, and the hotel is charming and old-fashioned. I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely View of Oberammergau

likes.liked: — I liked the superb view from my balcony.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, I was assigned to room 26 which is on the fourth floor. There is a small elevator, but the floor plan is confusing, so it took me a bit to figure out where I was going. The room decor is plain with a tiny bath and spartan furnishings. The entry serves as a dressing room with closet and ample place to store luggage. The main room is small with sliding doors opening onto a private terrace overlooking Oberammergau. The view itself is worth staying at the ParkHotel Sonnenhof.
reviews.title: Location saves the day

likes.liked: — Looking out at the mountains and the town
likes.disliked: — The lift giving out the floor below ours; the lack of coffee overnight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bed was firm without top sheet as is customary in this part of the world. The eiderdown puffy quilt was warm and cozy and pillows were fine. Bath is equipped with a blow drier, no face cloths, and no soap, so bring these if you like to use them. Both are considered unhygenic here in Bavaria. You get body wash in a container fixed to the wall of the shower instead. Lighting in the room was just ok...desk was unusable because the TV rested on it. Heat and hot water was fine.
reviews.title: Solid 3-Star

likes.disliked: — The decor and age of the furnishings

reviews.title: Perfect White Christmas
reviews.text: The hotel is fun to explore. There is a small indoor pool and hot tub and an entire floor devoted to dining. Breakfast is quite good here with a nice selection of rolls, breads, and croissants. The soft boiled eggs are really soft boiled and are excellent...when they sit for a while, this is a major accomplishment. The cheeses, wursts, and cold meats are local and good. The sliced roast pork I recommend. And the marmelades are excellent. I had dinner in the hotel twice and I have to say that overall, the food service is quite good - the best part of my stay in Oberammergau.

reviews.title: A really nice place for family, excellent food
reviews.text: Me, my wife, our son (18) and daughter (12) stayed for 2 weeks in Oberammergau (Bavarian Alps). We have been several times at this famous village on other places, but first time in the Parkhotel Sonnenhof. There is a very friendly stuff, which always takes trouble of everything you want, but never obtrusive. There is attractive Bavarian furniture in the rooms and Sanitation is very clean, also the nice wellness area (pool, adventure showers, steam sauna, massage, gymnastic, cosmetic, and more). Very recommendable is the dinner (several hors d'oeuvres, buffet, desserts) and you can select between 3 different meals, all is very wellmade. Great is Andys cocktail bar in the evening, where we met a lot of nice people and once in a week they have good live guitar music (oldies, western and Bavarian songs). On saturday we enjoyed the Bavarian live music (accordion) in the restaurant. They have a lot of other events for guests, f.e. "stossbuddeln", which is something like bowling.

reviews.title: Pricey but terrific for kids
reviews.text: This was one of the nicest places we found in Germany and we will come again.

description: Cozy Hotel in a charming mountain setting overlooking town & Rhine valley, 10 km from Buchs train station (Switzerland).
